Hi,

Thanks for this information.  I did take a look at the product but decided
it wasn't very useful for what I needed to do, which is test to simulate a
client using a MIDP application (i.e. routine tests, such as verifying that
when you launch the app. all the menu options are there).

We opted for a GUI testing tool for now until we find a better tool (or the
time to make one :-) ) to test something like this.

Just out of curiosity what would you like to use it for?




  -----Original Message-----
  From: quikdraw@...
[mailto:quikdraw@...]
  Sent: Tuesday, April 01, 2003 08:19 PM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [junit] MIDP Testing Tools


  Katie Gerg wrote:

  > Does anyone know of any MIDP testing tools?

  Katie,

  The only one I am aware of is J2MEUnit, which is a port of
  JUnit and is currently limited to MIDP 1.0. It is also pre-
  JDK 1.4 which means Assert.assert() and the assert keyword
  will collide. The good news is it is easy to change Assert.assert()
  to Assert.assertTrue(). The bad news is I've been fighting
  with getting the preverifier to work for several days now
  without success. Perhaps success is just around the corner...

  Maybe you will have more luck. If you do, please let me know
  what the trick is! <G>

  http://www.xprogramming.com/ftp/TestingFramework/j2me/J2MEUnit1_0.zip
  --
  Thanks,
  Derek Lane
  =====================================
  --- The Gunslinger
